Articles.Content:
I noticed today that I am no longer seeing Aerodynamic effects on reentry. I checked my settings, and my Aerodynamic FX Quality is greyed out; saying "No Hardware Support". I am running the same machine I have used since I first started KSP... I think that this ahas been going on for a while, and it did not click that I was missing the flame and mach effects, as my craft still glows red.

My most recent output_log is at:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/huxwm0ia4bbpog0/output_log.txt?dl=01

my setting.cfg, if it may help is at:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/5j0hfmsvho09g8e/settings.cfg?dl=0

Edited November 18, 2014 by ABZB
Solved

Forcing GfxDevice: 0

OpenGL:

Version: OpenGL 4.0 [4.0.0 - Build 10.18.10.3958]

Renderer: Intel® HD Graphics 4000

Vendor: Intel

XInput1_3.dll not found.
WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Reflective/VertexLit' - Invalid texture combiner

Shader 'AtmosphereFromGround': fallback shader 'None' not found

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/BlurEffectConeTap' - Invalid texture combiner

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/Glow Downsample' - Invalid texture combiner

ARB shader compile error: Error, line 3: same option specified twice.

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/AddAlphaHack' - Pass '' shader state not supported

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/AddAlphaHack' - Pass '' shader state not supported

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/AddAlphaHack' - Setting to default shader.

WARNING: Shader Unsupported: 'Hidden/GlowConeTap' - Invalid texture combiner

Well, it looks like you're forcing openGL on a card that doesn't like to use it for KSP's effects, if you are using -force-opengl try -force-d3d9 or -force-d3d11 instead

Well, it looks like you're forcing openGL on a card that doesn't like to use it for KSP's effects, if you are using -force-opengl try -force-d3d9 or -force-d3d11 instead

Ah! Thank you very much. I am using that KSP RAM Saver - I was using version 1.0 - it forces openGL. Apparently there is now a 2.0 that allows choice of what to implement. (http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98358-KSP-RAM-Saver)
If it gives you the option of D3D11 mode give it a try, I hear it's as good as if not better than openGL on Windows
